item.title: Biryani (Layman)
item.description: Oil Root Spices (clover, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, cumin seeds, Bay leaf, Mint leaves, etc.) Powdered Spices (Turmeric, Biryani Masala, Red Chili Powder) Salt to Taste Onions Ginger Garlic Vegetables Carrots Peas Cauliflower Potatoes Green Chillis Jalopenos Green/Red Bell Peppers Green Beans Rice After Cooking, Add Green Fresh Cilantro

item.title: Fried Rice
item.description: Rice 6 cup cooked Onions 3 medium Green onions 4 sticks Garlic 3 table spoons Ginger 1 table spoons Small akount of carrots and peas Lots of mushrooms Bean sprouts Lots of soy sauce 6-7 table spoons 4-6 table spoons

item.title: Manchurian Sauce
item.description: Ingredients Oil (Olive/Avacado/Canola) (2-3 Tbsp) Tier 1 Onion (Half finely chopped) Garlic (6 cloves - Minced) Green Chilli (1-2 Depending on Spice level and preference) Tier 2 Seasme Oil (1 Tbsp) Soy Sauce (3 Tbsp) Fish Sauce (1 Tsp) Ketchup (1 Tbsp) Vinegar (1 Tbsp) Sugar (1 Tbsp) Tier 3 Water (2 Cups) Tier 4 Water (1/2 Cup) Corn Starch (2 Tbsp) Tier 5 Green Onions (1/2 Cup) Prep Tier 1 Finely Chop Onions Mince Gralic Finely Chop green chilli Mix Tier 2 ingredients Mix Tier 4 ingredients Tier 5 Chop Green Onions Process Heat up Oil in a wok (on High Heath) ~ 1 Minute Throw in Tier 1 ~ 4 Minutes Let it cook for 5 minutes (or until onions starts turning translucent) Don’t let Garlic burn Throw in Tier 2 ~ 4 Minutes Let it cook for 4 minutes Throw in Tier 3 ~ 5-6 minutes Let it cook until water comes to boil Throw in Tier 4 and Mix well ~ 1 minute Throw in Tier 5 and Mix well ~ 1 minute Turn off the stove and let it sit for ~ 5-10 minutes
